meanings.definition: To remove a crown from someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The king felt sad when they uncrowned him.
meanings.sent2: She uncrowned the statue to clean it.
meanings.sent3: The magician uncrowned the rabbit, revealing a hidden card.
meanings.sent4: The storm uncrowned the trees, leaving them bare.
meanings.sent5: The knight's duty was to uncrown the false king.

meanings.definition: To deprive of royal or high status.
meanings.sent1: The scandal uncrowned the once-beloved actress.
meanings.sent2: He feared the gossip would uncrown him from his position.
meanings.sent3: The prankster uncrowned the class clown with a clever joke.
meanings.sent4: The defeat in battle uncrowned the undefeated champion.
meanings.sent5: The humble hero's actions uncrowned the arrogant ruler.

meanings.definition: The act of removing a crown.
meanings.sent1: The uncrowning of the queen was a solemn ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed the uncrowning of the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent3: The play featured a comical uncrowning scene with mistaken identities.
meanings.sent4: The uncrowning of the sun at dusk painted the sky in hues of orange.
meanings.sent5: The uncrowning of the champion marked the beginning of a new era.
